image.altText: Andrew Barr standing holding papers in the ACT Legislative Assembly chamber.

props.synopsis: Andrew Barr unveils the new ACT Legislative Assembly cabinet and promises an overhaul of the public service.

title.children: Andrew Barr announces new cabinet and overhaul of ACT public service

image.altText: A group of people stand behind a lecturn.

props.synopsis: Ruling out forming a new coalition government with Labor could allow the ACT Greens to reset their priorities. But there is also a chance they will regret the decision.Â

title.children: In recent times, the ACT Greens have been playing the hokey pokey, but now they are out

image.altText: A graphic illustration of a Toyota, showing the DPF filter in the engine.

props.synopsis: The action was brought by thousands of people who bought faulty Toyota and Ford cars between 2015-2020.

title.children: High Court to allow appeal from Toyota and Ford owners in compensation case over faulty vehicles

image.altText: students walk around at the university of canberra

props.synopsis: With jobs to be cut at both of Canberra's major universities, some staff members are concerned about the way the process has been handled so far by management.

title.children: 'There's a sense of shock': Difficult times ahead for universities in Australia's knowledge capital

image.altText: Queensland police GPS tracker on an ankle worn by a person on a Brisbane city street.

props.synopsis: The federal government loses a crucial High Court battle over a law requiring former immigration detainees to be monitored by ankle bracelets and live under a curfew.

title.children: Government loses High Court case on legality of curfew and ankle bracelets

image.altText: Two men holding booklets entitled "The Integrated Energy Plan'' stand in front of  a back drop with "ACT Government'' logos.

props.synopsis: The Greens confirm they will not join a Labor-led government as the ACT Legislative Assembly prepares to sit for the first time since the territory election.

title.children: ACT Greens say they will not form coalition with Labor following failed negotiations over 'big issues'

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Lisa Wilkinson unsuccessfully argued against delaying the case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against defamation case findings delayed

image.altText: A large chunk of blackened land surrounding a small regional town.

props.synopsis: Temperatures are pushing into the forties in the eastern states as the focus shifts to an "extensive" thunderstorm risk.Â

title.children: 'Extensive' thunderstorm risk in eastern Australia as temperatures push into the 40s

image.altText: Two men in suits talking

props.synopsis: Australia's Ambassador to the United States Kevin Rudd has deleted a series of old tweets sharply criticising US President-elect Donald Trump. Follow live.Â

title.children: Kevin Rudd deletes tweets calling Trump 'traitor to the West', 'most destructive president in history'

image.altText: A freestanding sign advertising a Chemist Warehouse store and its opening hours.

props.synopsis: Discount pharmacy retailer Chemist Warehouse will be allowed to merge with Sigma Healthcare to create an $8.8 billion pharmaceutical giant after being approved by Australia's competition regulator.

title.children: Chemist Warehouse allowed to merge with Sigma Healthcare after receiving ACCC approval

image.altText: FILE PHOTO: Republican presidential nominee and former U.S. President Donald Trump holds a campaign rally in Novi, Michigan

props.synopsis: Donald Trump will return to the White House, leaving allies like Australia â and rivals like China â wondering what might be coming next.

title.children: Hereâs what Donald Trump in the White House (again) might mean for Australia

image.altText: The silhouette of a man walking on to a stage

props.synopsis: Voters not only swept Donald Trump into the White House for a second time, but delivered his Republican Party a likely majority in the Senate and a possible one in the house at Tuesday's election. He also won the popular vote for the first time.

title.children: Trump White House has 'powerful mandate' after Republican domination

image.altText: A photo showing a woman wearing a red denim jacket looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis:
Fears 'Voice, Treaty, Truth is dead in Queensland' as new government moves to officially shut down truth-telling inquiry.

Â

title.children: Federal government tells Queenslandâs LNP to 'hold your horses' on truth-telling inquiry

image.altText: Illustrative map of America made from hexagons half red and half blue.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump will return to the White House in January with a mandate for change. See his path to victory.

title.children: Hereâs how Trump turned the election map on its head

image.altText: A drone shot of an open pit showing what appears to be coal and machinery operating there

props.synopsis: The federal approval process for a new coal mine in Queensland is pressing ahead, despite revelations the project is under criminal investigation for illegal land clearing.

title.children: 'Astounding': New revelation in illegal land clearing case

image.altText: A plume of smoke rising high into the sky over a hilly landscape in Lebanon

props.synopsis: The Israeli military urged residents in some parts of the country to leave their homes ahead of the strikes. It comes as a UN aid agency working in Gaza warns an Israeli ban on its operations would have "disastrous consequences".

title.children: At least 38 killed, 54 injured in Lebanon as Israel and Hezbollah launch strikes at each other

image.altText: B-Girl Raygun competes for Australia in the breaking event at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Rachel Gunn, aka Raygun, says she will no longer compete in the sport of breaking after the vitriolic reaction to her performance at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

title.children: 'Raygun' retires from breaking after 'upsetting' Olympic experience

image.altText: Poo ball in test tube

props.synopsis: Authorities initially feared these balls could be made of toxic tar. Further testing from scientists indicated they are closer to 'fatbergs' typically found in sewers.Â

title.children: Hundreds of mysterious balls washed on Sydney beaches. Now we know the 'disgusting' substances in them

image.altText: The Charging Bull statue on Wall Street

props.synopsis: The prospect of a second Donald Trump presidency has pushed the US share market and bitcoin to new record highs, while the Australian dollar has slumped and the ASX is on track to begin its day steady. Follow live.

title.children: Wall Street hits new record high on Donald Trump victory, Australian dollar sinks

image.altText: Xiaozheng Lin at court with his head covered.

props.synopsis: Justice Stephen Kaye described the killings of two "defenceless" sex workers in Melbourne as "without any justification at all".

title.children: Man who killed two women in 24 hours to be jailed for at least seven years, then deported

image.altText: An asian woman in a hallway

props.synopsis: A Brisbane councillor is refusing to comply with a legal threat from One Nation, instead offering to take its leader to meet multicultural students "proudly singing the national anthem".

title.children: Councillor offers to shout Pauline Hanson a bubble tea after legal threat for calling her racist

image.altText: Two people embracing on stage during US election day

props.synopsis: The winners of several congressional and senate races up and down the ballot have made historic firsts in the 2024 US election.

title.children: Outside the presidential race, these candidates achieved historic firsts

image.altText: Francis and a US Navy officer with his face blurred smile for a photo.

props.synopsis: Malaysian military contractor Leonard Francis has been sentenced to 15 years in prison for bribing US naval officers with decadent gifts and services.

title.children: 'Fat Leonard' sentenced to 15 years behind bars in US Navy corruption scandal

image.altText: Castle Bravo nuclear test

props.synopsis:
With the world "on the brink of a potential nuclear war", scientists are trying to work out just how bad it would be.

Â 

Â

title.children: Our idea of what nuclear war would mean dates back to the 1980s. The UN is doing an update

image.altText: A girl with pig tails and fringe smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Lisa Mott was 12 years old when she disappeared from her home in Collie in October 1980. Cold case investigators have returned to the town in the hope of drawing out fresh leads.

title.children: Lisa Mott was last seen getting into a yellow panel van four decades ago. Can she be found?

image.altText: an emu on a highway during a heatwave

props.synopsis: Weather conditions bringing soaring temperatures to large parts of the country are moving north-east and set to raise the mercury in Queensland and northern New South Wales on Thursday and Friday.

title.children: 'Mass of hot, windy air' set to raise temperatures further in Brisbane and Sydney

image.altText: Lettuce being

props.synopsis: The Story family know where every lettuce plant they grow is going and what they'll be paid for it, but it hasn't always been this way.

title.children: Fast food chains help savvy farmers give supermarket price uncertainty the slip

image.altText: A wide shot of Townsville's modern CBD.

props.synopsis: It took Queensland Police 16 hours to track down the parents of the boy, who was wandering the Townsville CBD alone.

title.children: Young boy found wandering Queensland city alone reunited with parents

image.altText: Aerial view of a group of kayakers

props.synopsis: The activism group has recruited the likes of Peter Garrett for the demonstration, which has been promoted as a "protestival" designed to block access to the Port of Newcastle.

title.children: Supreme Court prohibits Rising Tide climate protest on Newcastle harbour

image.altText: Two women stand for a photoshoot, wearing military jackets. One holds her fingers close to the other's mouth.

props.synopsis: In the 1980s, two young Sydney-siders came across a women-run erotica magazine from San Francisco aimed at lesbians, and were inspired to create something for their own community.Â

title.children: Wicked Women helped change how Australia saw lesbians. Now, this iconic zine is being reimagined

image.altText: A truck on its side on the highway.

props.synopsis: Two trucks heading in opposite directions collided near Tregony, on the Southern Downs, causing both to rollover.Â

title.children: 'Chaotic scene': Two dead and six injured after trucks collide south-west of Brisbane

image.altText: India A players talk with an umpire

props.synopsis: Former Test opening partners David Warner and Ed Cowan have slammed Cricket Australia for brushing allegations of ball tampering from India A under the carpet.

title.children: 'You can't choose when integrity matters': Cowan, Warner slam Cricket Australia

image.altText: Tyrone Mings claps

props.synopsis: Aston Villa's perfect Champions League start came to a crashing halt with Tyrone Mings literally handing Club Brugge victory in Belgium after a "farcical" error.

title.children: Watch as 'ridiculous' handball ends Villa's Champions League winning run

image.altText: Gemma Houghton follows through with kicking a ball, with a defender trying to smother

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide heads into its maiden AFLW finals match on a six-game winning streak but comes up against Richmond, the last team to beat it.

title.children: Port Adelaide and Richmond poised for blockbuster AFLW elimination final
